ygData.subject: Re: Kobold Vs Tier'Dal
ygData.msgSnippet: Shame we are on different servers, I would gladly improve your languages, but I have a question for you.....You mention Monk when refering to Dragon (Are they
ygData.messageBody:
Shame we are on different servers, I would gladly improve your languages, but I have a question for you.....You mention Monk when refering to Dragon (Are they the ones who learn it?) Also anyone have any ideas what Gnoll, Lizardman, Froglok, and
Goblin (also heard there's Orc too) are for?

Currently speaking all race languages, plus Elder Elvish, Old Erudian, Elder Teir'dal, and Combine to excellent on Innoruuk.

Kush
Gnome Wizard
Seeker of all Knowledge

Kyle Plowden wrote:

> From: "Kyle Plowden" <damage43@...>
>
> On the Subject of languages. Kobold and elder Tier D'al are the same.
> It's the same for Dark Elven and Tier D'al. They show up as two different
> names depending on whether you are looking at the chat window or the skills
> listing. It also seems I am able to learn the basics of a new language each
> level I advance. I have recently gotten Lizardman and Goblin from my
> trainer. My languages so far are :
>
> Common, Elder Elvish, Elvish, Dwarven, Dark Elven/Tier D'al, Erudin, Old
> Erudin, Gnoll, Barbarian, Gnomish, Halfling, Dark Speech, Kobold/Elder Tier
> D'al, Ogre, Troll, Goblin, and Lizard Man.
>
> I'm still looking for a high level monk to teach me the basics of Dragon.
>
>
> Dalthas
> Dark Elf Necromancer
> Currently lvl 17
> Bristlebain
>
